result.execSummary:
The defendant King Serna Loranca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 6/1/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. King Serna Loranca

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to POSSESSION OF THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3e)(e), a Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 6-1-2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the report.  Defendant is attending programming at the Day Reporting Center and testing negative.    Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 7/14/2014 at 8:30 am.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Christopher J Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Chelsee Bates.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.   Court orders Defendant be drug tested on his next office visit and that he bring all prescriptions with him.    All other conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains calendared for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing on May 30, 2014 in Branch 8:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered a DPA in this case.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 5/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/2/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant King Serna Loranca in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant King Serna Loranca in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch3*.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
